paper.title: Futzing and Moseying: Interviews with Professional Data Analysts on Exploration Practices
author: Alspaugh,Sara
Zokaei,Nava
Liu,Andrea
Jin,Cindy
Hearst,MartiA.
paper.soname: IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON VISUALIZATION AND COMPUTER GRAPHICS
paper.abstract: We report the results of interviewing thirty professional data analysts working in a range of industrial, academic, and regulatory environments. This study focuses on participants' descriptions of exploratory activities and tool usage in these activities. Highlights of the findings include: distinctions between exploration as a precursor to more directed analysis versus truly open-ended exploration; confirmation that some analysts see "finding something interesting" as a valid goal of data exploration while others explicitly disavow this goal; conflicting views about the role of intelligent tools in data exploration; and pervasive use of visualization for exploration, but with only a subset using direct manipulation interfaces. These findings provide guidelines for future tool development, as well as a better understanding of the meaning of the term "data exploration" based on the words of practitioners "in the wild."
